programme.title: Episode 18
programme.desc: After the 24-hour race was over we left the Nuerburgring and moved to Büren, Germany, where the Raeder Motorsport company is based. They are famous for front-wheel drives with a great performance that put a lot of horsepower to the track.

programme.title: The Remote Control
programme.desc: Stuntman Tobi operates an Artega GT at full speed via remote control. This is just a warm-up before the big stunt, in which he drives a car up a steep ramp at 68 mph. The question is: How high can remote-controlled cars fly?

programme.title: Stunt Highlights
programme.desc: Stunt coordinator Christoph looks back at the stunts of the last twelve shows and explains why a stunt sometimes works better in a test than on the film set. It's a summary of all the stunts of season 2, in addition to the best outtakes.

programme.title: Nova SS vs Honda Accord
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car On TV, car fans from the Middle East can have their darlings rated in terms of speed, style and sound. Included this time: a Nova SS, a special Honda Accord and a car clad in crystals.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: The "Walk" at JBR in Dubai is the venue for our competition, as far as fancy and luxurious cars from all over the Middle East are concerned. This time, a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet are among the participants.

programme.title: Sports SUVs
programme.desc: Three extraordinarily sporty SUVs are the Porsche Macan Turbo, the Mercedes GLA 45 AMG and the Audi RSQ3. Each of these is able to easily cope with each season of the year and, in regards to performance, could be mistaken for a sports car.

programme.title: La Dolce Vita
programme.desc: With the Alfieri, Maserati in 2014 celebrated their anniversary with the introduction of a beautiful grand tourer. In remembrance and as part of the three-day celebration, Maserati organised a cruise from Bologna to Torino with some of their most iconic cars.

programme.title: Fiat Dino
programme.desc: The Fiat Dino Spider is one of the most beautiful cabriolets of the 1960s. Its impeccable design was created by Pininfarina, and only 525 units were built. Under its hood growls a Ferrari V6 engine.

programme.title: The Most Exciting Classic Car Races
programme.desc: Exciting GT sports cars from the 1960s, the pre-war Silver Arrows, hot classic cars on ice and historic Formula 1 cars. We present the most exciting classic car races in Germany.

programme.title: Cruising
programme.desc: We explored how the Z4 Roadster feels as a cabriolet. Also: the small company Boom Trikes Automotive have become Europe's leading trike manufacturer. And: cruising through Los Angeles in a Volkswagen Beetle convertible.

programme.title: Diesel Engines
programme.desc: It's all about Diesel this time. We compared the BMW 120d and the 125i. In addition: Audi's diesel-hybrid model R18 e-tron quattro dominated the endurance race in Le Mans. And: the diesel-powered Jaguar XF Sport Brake.

programme.title: McLaren MP4 12C GT3
programme.desc: McLaren's MP4 12C GT3 is as fast as a Formula One car. We explored how this super sports car came to be. Also: the German company Mechatronik specializes in restoring rare and classic cars like the Mercedes W111.

programme.title: Supercars of the Frankfurt Motor Show
programme.desc: We took a look at the IAA Frankfurt 2011 highlights, like the new Porsche 911, Mercedes' SLS AMG Roadster, the Bentley Continental Convertible, a 1,100 hp monster from Croatia and others.

programme.title: Episode 10
programme.desc: Christian Menzel asked our presenter Miriam to participate in a driver safety training where he showed tips and tricks on what to do in emergency situations.

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Chevy Camaro vs Mercedes SLS AMG
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi invite car freaks from the Middle East to show off their souped-up vehicles on the "Walk" at Jumeirah Beach in Dubai. In this episode, a Chevrolet Camaro competes against a Mercedes SLS AMG.

programme.title: BMW X5 vs Mercedes SLK 230
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: If you like souped-up and luxuriously equipped vehicles, Jumeirah Beach in Dubai is the place to be. There, the cars are judged and there is also something to win. This episode features a BMW X5 and a Mercedes SLK 230.

programme.title: McLaren MP4 12C GT3
programme.desc: McLaren's MP4 12C GT3 is as fast as a Formula One car. We explored how this super sports car came to be. Also: the German company Mechatronik specializes in restoring rare and classic cars like the Mercedes W111.

programme.title: Supercars of the Frankfurt Motor Show
programme.desc: We took a look at the IAA Frankfurt 2011 highlights, like the new Porsche 911, Mercedes' SLS AMG Roadster, the Bentley Continental Convertible, a 1,100 hp monster from Croatia and others.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: The "Walk" at JBR in Dubai is the venue for our competition, as far as fancy and luxurious cars from all over the Middle East are concerned. This time, a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet are among the participants.

programme.title: Nova SS vs Honda Accord
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car On TV, car fans from the Middle East can have their darlings rated in terms of speed, style and sound. Included this time: a Nova SS, a special Honda Accord and a car clad in crystals.

programme.title: Episode 16
programme.desc: In this episode we invite you to witness the progress of driver Uwe Nittle as he got ready for qualifying at the Truck Grand Prix.

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Audi Sport Quattro S1, Part 1
programme.desc: The Audi Sport quattro S1 is the most powerful and exciting rally car ever built. Based on the regular quattro, the S1 with its giant wings spread anxiety, fear and excitement among rally drivers and fans. Part 1 of 2

programme.title: Volvo 240
programme.desc: The Volvo 240T is a typical family car, it's rather heavy, sedate and not sporty at all. But hardly anyone knows that this Swedish car was once the real deal on the rally race track.

programme.title: Tuning World
programme.desc: For more than 20 years the Tuning World Bodensee has been one of the top events in the European car tuning scene. Also: with their i-models BMW started to explore alternative drive technologies. And: taking the Nissan Leaf to Oslo.

programme.title: All New!
programme.desc: Following the Porsche 911's anniversary we take a look back at this iconic model's history. Also: the world's first series-produced plug-in hybrid with a diesel engine, the Volvo V60. And: safety measures in the car world, from seatbelts to crash tests.

programme.title: Pikes Peak
programme.desc: The Pikes Peak Hill Climb is a rather unique type of car race in the mountains of Colorado, USA. It's exciting, tough and dangerous, and in 1987, two-time world rally champion Walter Roehrl took his Audi Sport Quattro S1 to the top.

programme.title: German Rallye Championship 1983
programme.desc: Since its premiere in 1970 the Deutsche Rallye Meisterschaft has been one of the most popular motorsports series. In the 1983 competition Opel's Manta, Kadett and Ascona sports models celebrated exceptional successes.

programme.title: Mobility in Eastern Europe
programme.desc: In the 1950s, companies like Tatra from Czechoslovakia introduced advanced, even pioneering automobiles. The clientele was exclusive, which is why now these streamlined cars are big rarities. We tracked down the owner of a 1937 Tatra T87.

programme.title: Porsche Carrera RS
programme.desc: In the early 1970s the Porsche Carrera RS was the fastest and most agile production sports car in Germany. Today the RS is a Porsche classic with highest acclaim.

programme.title: French Classics
programme.desc: French manufacturers have also built milestones in automotive history in the past, including lesser-known brands such as Delage and Talbot, but also vehicles from Peugeot, Renault and Citroen.

programme.title: Scrapyard Gold
programme.desc: It is not too unusual to find hidden gems of automotive history in a perfect condition in barns or scrap yards. Also: the MGC GT Sebring, that was built for the 12 Hours of Sebring race.

programme.title: Mercedes Races again 1954/55
programme.desc: After more than 20 years of abstinence Mercedes-Benz return to the Grand Prix circuit in 1954. With a lot of ambition, the company's advanced engineering and some of the best drivers in the world the Mercedes team aimed for the championship.

programme.title: Walter Röhrl
programme.desc: One cannot talk about rally sports without mentioning the name Walter Röhrl. From an early age, Röhrl showed his talent in rally sports and won the European, World and other international rally championships several times in his career.

programme.title: Hans-Joachim Stuck
programme.desc: Hans-Joachim Stuck is one of the best racing drivers in Germany. Over his long career he not only won the Formula II and several international touring car championships multiple times but also the famous 24-hour race of Le Mans twice.

programme.title: Pikes Peak
programme.desc: The Pikes Peak Hill Climb is a rather unique type of car race in the mountains of Colorado, USA. It's exciting, tough and dangerous, and in 1987, two-time world rally champion Walter Roehrl took his Audi Sport Quattro S1 to the top.

programme.title: Le Mans 1952
programme.desc: The year 1952 saw several premieres at the legendary 24-hour endurance race of Le Mans. After 22 years Mercedes-Benz returned to the famous circuit, and Ferrari started to use factory works team cars for the first time.

programme.title: Bizzarrini 5300 GT
programme.desc: Giotto Bizzarrini was the creator of the famous Ferrari GTO, but after arguments with his employer he left Ferrari early. To get back at Ferrari, Bizzarrini decided to create his own sports car: the Bizzarrini GT 5300.

programme.title: Fiat Dino
programme.desc: The Fiat Dino Spider is one of the most beautiful cabriolets of the 1960s. Its impeccable design was created by Pininfarina, and only 525 units were built. Under its hood growls a Ferrari V6 engine.

programme.title: Women and their Classic Cars
programme.desc: A small group of car enthusiastic ladies offers resistance in the otherwise man dominated classic car world. One of them is Johanna. The 24-year-old loves her 1969 Corvette more than everything.

programme.title: Scrapyard Gold
programme.desc: It is not too unusual to find hidden gems of automotive history in a perfect condition in barns or scrap yards. Also: the MGC GT Sebring, that was built for the 12 Hours of Sebring race.

programme.title: Sportscars for the Masses
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang has been an icon for decades. What makes this car so special? In addition: the Nissan 370 Z Nismo is half as expensive as a Porsche 911, but its power is on par with the German flagship. And: the 7th generation Volkswagen Golf GTI and R.

programme.title: Electrically into the Future
programme.desc: The Tesla Model S is an icon for inventiveness and boldness. In addition: the BMW i3 was the first car from Germany that completly relied on electric propulsion. And: Citroen gave their glimpse into the future with the DS 5 Hybrid.

programme.title: Ferrari FF
programme.desc: The Ferrari Four, also called Ferrari FF, is the first four-wheel family car from Maranello. Also: the BMW M5 shines both as a family and business car. And: the Mercedes-Benz SL is a roadster drivers' dream.

programme.title: When Sports Meets Indulgence
programme.desc: Luxury class grand tourers with four doors. Porsche introduced their Panamera as a Plugin Hybrid or equipped with new turbo engines. BMW responded with their M6 Gran Coupe. German engineering at its finest.

programme.title: Salto Mortale
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes face a new mission: performing a front-flip through the air with a stuntman behind the wheel of an estate wagon. Stuntmen Daniel and Lars display a brilliant fight choreography in some spectacular driving scenes.

programme.title: The Remote Control
programme.desc: Stuntman Tobi operates an Artega GT at full speed via remote control. This is just a warm-up before the big stunt, in which he drives a car up a steep ramp at 68 mph. The question is: How high can remote-controlled cars fly?

programme.title: Episode 21
programme.desc: In this episode, we focused on Phoenix Racing, the successful team from the Eifel Region that rocked the DTM.

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Kelleners KS1 RS
programme.desc: The BMW One M Coupe from the former race-driver Ralf Kelleners: the KS1 RS is one of the highlights in 2012. Also: another big score from Porsche, the beautiful 911 cabriolet. And: the Bentley Continental GT V8 is a dream car.

programme.title: Porsche to the Max
programme.desc: The Techart Grand GT by Porsche's house tuner is a souped-up Panamera. But the off-the-shelf GTS model also has its treats. Patrick Simon took this monster to the track. In addition: Ruf's anniversary model RT 35. And: the 911 Carrera 4.

programme.title: BMW Motorrad Berlin
programme.desc: The first vehicle that BMW ever produced was a motorcycle, the R23. We take a look at the brand's motorcycle factory in Berlin. Also: the KTM 125 Duke, a bike that isn't just for beginners. And: the "Night of the Jumps", an exciting freestyle motocross spectacle at Munich's Olympiahalle.

programme.title: Blacktrail E-Bike
programme.desc: The Blacktrail by PG Bikes is the fastest and lightest E-bike in the world, but also the most expensive. What's behind this exciting power package from Regensburg, Germany? Also: is BMW's new flagship bike, the K 1600 GT with 6 cylinders really worth its price and is it able to stand up to the competition by Honda, Kawasaki and Benelli?

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Episode 22
programme.desc: At the Nuerburgring Patrick chased a 12-cylinder Aston Martin Zagato down the track. Also on the show: a Hummer, a Renault Clio and a Frenchman in a Ferrari.

programme.title: Episode 21
programme.desc: In this episode, we focused on Phoenix Racing, the successful team from the Eifel Region that rocked the DTM.

programme.title: Bizzarrini 5300 GT
programme.desc: Giotto Bizzarrini was the creator of the famous Ferrari GTO, but after arguments with his employer he left Ferrari early. To get back at Ferrari, Bizzarrini decided to create his own sports car: the Bizzarrini GT 5300.

programme.title: French Classics
programme.desc: French manufacturers have also built milestones in automotive history in the past, including lesser-known brands such as Delage and Talbot, but also vehicles from Peugeot, Renault and Citroen.

programme.title: Offroad for Everybody
programme.desc: Opel's Insignia Tourer Country was the German brand's first family car in outdoor attire. In addition: with the Capture Renault presented their first compact SUV. And: what happens when Fiat's cute compact 500 is inflated to the 500L Trekking?

programme.title: Open Air Concert
programme.desc: As an homage to driving top-down we took a look at three of the most beautiful convertibles. The animalistic sound of the Audi S3 convertible's 4-cylinder is astonishing. But what about the Nissan 370 Z Roadster? Or Porsche's Boxster GTS?

programme.title: Mercedes SLS vs Audi R8
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi once again invite the owners of the most extraordinary cars to Dubai, where they award points for speed, style and sound. This time, they will be joined by a limited edition Mercedes SLS and an Audi R8.

programme.title: BMW X6M vs Nissan Patrol
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: At Jumeirah Beach in Dubai, car owners can have their souped-up vehicles judged in three categories and win an overnight stay at the Sofitel Hotel. This time, a BMW X6M, a Ford F250 and a Nissan Patrol are in the running.

programme.title: Lamborghini
programme.desc: Sant'Agata Bolognese, the home of the iconic Italian sports car manufacturer Lamborghini, is the perfect place to take a look under the hood of the different Gallardo models. Also: cruising through Rome in an Aventador LP700-4.

programme.title: Audi at Le Mans
programme.desc: At the 2012 Le Mans 24 Hours, Audi entered the R18 e-tron quattro for the first time. Also: the Porsche Cayenne GTS, the model between the S and the Turbo. And: the Mercedes-Benz CLS Shooting Brake.

programme.title: Episode 17
programme.desc: The RCN Challenge is the ultimate BMW driving experience. We also paid a visit to the Devils Diner, the track's indoor meeting place for drivers.

programme.title: Episode 18
programme.desc: After the 24-hour race was over we left the Nuerburgring and moved to Büren, Germany, where the Raeder Motorsport company is based. They are famous for front-wheel drives with a great performance that put a lot of horsepower to the track.

programme.title: Episode 14
programme.desc: The fourth race of the VLN season is usually regarded as a dress rehearsal for the 24-hour race. For the top teams and best drivers it is the last opportunity for a really thorough test.

programme.title: The Remote Control
programme.desc: Stuntman Tobi operates an Artega GT at full speed via remote control. This is just a warm-up before the big stunt, in which he drives a car up a steep ramp at 68 mph. The question is: How high can remote-controlled cars fly?

programme.title: Stunt Highlights
programme.desc: Stunt coordinator Christoph looks back at the stunts of the last twelve shows and explains why a stunt sometimes works better in a test than on the film set. It's a summary of all the stunts of season 2, in addition to the best outtakes.

programme.title: Nova SS vs Honda Accord
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car On TV, car fans from the Middle East can have their darlings rated in terms of speed, style and sound. Included this time: a Nova SS, a special Honda Accord and a car clad in crystals.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: The "Walk" at JBR in Dubai is the venue for our competition, as far as fancy and luxurious cars from all over the Middle East are concerned. This time, a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet are among the participants.

programme.title: Sports SUVs
programme.desc: Three extraordinarily sporty SUVs are the Porsche Macan Turbo, the Mercedes GLA 45 AMG and the Audi RSQ3. Each of these is able to easily cope with each season of the year and, in regards to performance, could be mistaken for a sports car.

programme.title: La Dolce Vita
programme.desc: With the Alfieri, Maserati in 2014 celebrated their anniversary with the introduction of a beautiful grand tourer. In remembrance and as part of the three-day celebration, Maserati organised a cruise from Bologna to Torino with some of their most iconic cars.

programme.title: Fiat Dino
programme.desc: The Fiat Dino Spider is one of the most beautiful cabriolets of the 1960s. Its impeccable design was created by Pininfarina, and only 525 units were built. Under its hood growls a Ferrari V6 engine.

programme.title: The Most Exciting Classic Car Races
programme.desc: Exciting GT sports cars from the 1960s, the pre-war Silver Arrows, hot classic cars on ice and historic Formula 1 cars. We present the most exciting classic car races in Germany.

programme.title: Cruising
programme.desc: We explored how the Z4 Roadster feels as a cabriolet. Also: the small company Boom Trikes Automotive have become Europe's leading trike manufacturer. And: cruising through Los Angeles in a Volkswagen Beetle convertible.

programme.title: Diesel Engines
programme.desc: It's all about Diesel this time. We compared the BMW 120d and the 125i. In addition: Audi's diesel-hybrid model R18 e-tron quattro dominated the endurance race in Le Mans. And: the diesel-powered Jaguar XF Sport Brake.

programme.title: McLaren MP4 12C GT3
programme.desc: McLaren's MP4 12C GT3 is as fast as a Formula One car. We explored how this super sports car came to be. Also: the German company Mechatronik specializes in restoring rare and classic cars like the Mercedes W111.

programme.title: Supercars of the Frankfurt Motor Show
programme.desc: We took a look at the IAA Frankfurt 2011 highlights, like the new Porsche 911, Mercedes' SLS AMG Roadster, the Bentley Continental Convertible, a 1,100 hp monster from Croatia and others.

programme.title: Episode 10
programme.desc: Christian Menzel asked our presenter Miriam to participate in a driver safety training where he showed tips and tricks on what to do in emergency situations.

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Episode 14
programme.desc: The fourth race of the VLN season is usually regarded as a dress rehearsal for the 24-hour race. For the top teams and best drivers it is the last opportunity for a really thorough test.

programme.title: Chevy Camaro vs Mercedes SLS AMG
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: Mylene Gomera and Saif Hattawi invite car freaks from the Middle East to show off their souped-up vehicles on the "Walk" at Jumeirah Beach in Dubai. In this episode, a Chevrolet Camaro competes against a Mercedes SLS AMG.

programme.title: BMW X5 vs Mercedes SLK 230
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: If you like souped-up and luxuriously equipped vehicles, Jumeirah Beach in Dubai is the place to be. There, the cars are judged and there is also something to win. This episode features a BMW X5 and a Mercedes SLK 230.

programme.title: McLaren MP4 12C GT3
programme.desc: McLaren's MP4 12C GT3 is as fast as a Formula One car. We explored how this super sports car came to be. Also: the German company Mechatronik specializes in restoring rare and classic cars like the Mercedes W111.

programme.title: Supercars of the Frankfurt Motor Show
programme.desc: We took a look at the IAA Frankfurt 2011 highlights, like the new Porsche 911, Mercedes' SLS AMG Roadster, the Bentley Continental Convertible, a 1,100 hp monster from Croatia and others.

programme.title: Lamborghini Aventador vs GMC Chevrolet
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: The "Walk" at JBR in Dubai is the venue for our competition, as far as fancy and luxurious cars from all over the Middle East are concerned. This time, a Lamborghini Aventador and a GMC Chevrolet are among the participants.

programme.title: Nova SS vs Honda Accord
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Put Your Car On TV
programme.desc: On Put Your Car On TV, car fans from the Middle East can have their darlings rated in terms of speed, style and sound. Included this time: a Nova SS, a special Honda Accord and a car clad in crystals.

programme.title: Episode 16
programme.desc: In this episode we invite you to witness the progress of driver Uwe Nittle as he got ready for qualifying at the Truck Grand Prix.

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Ron Williams and his Cadillac
programme.desc: The 1952 Cadillac Fleetwood is also known as the American Rolls-Royce, because it’s the car of celebrities, presidents, millionaires and mafia bosses. One owner of this rare classic car is German-American actor and entertainer Ron Williams.

programme.title: Porsche Carrera RS
programme.desc: In the early 1970s the Porsche Carrera RS was the fastest and most agile production sports car in Germany. Today the RS is a Porsche classic with highest acclaim.

programme.title: Ready for Action
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of some of the exciting stunts at Action Concept, the biggest action movie production company in Europe. Also: Johannes and Ferdinand Stuck with the BMW Alpina D5 Twin Turbo at the test track. And: the Volkswagen Up city car.

programme.title: Changing the model
programme.desc: BMW got into the electric mobility business with their ActiveE and i3 models. We visited the company's technology office in Silicon Valley. Also: the Stuck brothers at the test track with the Mercedes C 63 AMG. And: the Audi A3 Sportback.

programme.title: Mercedes ML 63 AMG
programme.desc: We put the Porsche Cayenne Turbo S and the Mercedes ML 63 AMG to the test. Also: the final round of the truck trial race at the Camp4fun at the Nürburgring in Germany. And: General Motors' new luxury SUV, the Cadillac SRX.

programme.title: Outback Off-Road Adventure
programme.desc: Australia's North-East is famous for its nature and wildlife. We accompanied the Germans Katrin and Uli on their 4x4 tour on the Great Tropical Drive in Queensland. Also: Clash of the Titans. We compared the Toyota Landcruiser and Mitsubishi Pajero.

programme.title: Volkswagen Phaeton Dresden
programme.desc: 2001 saw the new beginning of new chapter for Volkswagen. The company invested 187 million Euros into its so-called 'Transparent Factory' in Dresden to produce its Volkswagen Phaeton, setting new standards in the top class.

programme.title: BMW 5 Series GT, Part 1
programme.desc: What happens to car models that were designed in a thriving market but are launched as final products in times of market crisis? We accompanied the development history of a new BMW model, which starts with a design pitch.

programme.title: Walter Röhrl
programme.desc: One cannot talk about rally sports without mentioning the name Walter Röhrl. From an early age, Röhrl showed his talent in rally sports and won the European, World and other international rally championships several times in his career.

programme.title: Ferruccio Lamborghini
programme.desc: In 1964, Ferruccio Lamborghini set himself the goal to build the best sports cars in the world, a bold move, being located only a few kilometers from Ferrari.

programme.title: Ferry Porsche
programme.desc: After the Second World War, following in his father's footsteps who had been responsible for the development of the classic Volkswagen, Ferry Porsche laid the foundation for the brand's sports car models like the 356 and later the Porsche 911.

programme.title: All- Wheel bedrocks
programme.desc: Even though SUVs have only become trendy in recent years, there are several models that have defined this vehicle category. We present three such veterans: the Toyota RAV4, the Mercedes G-Class and the Jeep Wrangler.

programme.title: All-Wheel-Drive on station wagons
programme.desc: The Skoda Octavia, the Opel Insignia Country Tourer, the Subaru Outback, the Audi S4 allroad quattro and the Seat Leon x-perience want to be more than roomy family cars. Their offroad features show that it doesn't always have to be an SUV.

programme.title: Ready for Action
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of some of the exciting stunts at Action Concept, the biggest action movie production company in Europe. Also: Johannes and Ferdinand Stuck with the BMW Alpina D5 Twin Turbo at the test track. And: the Volkswagen Up city car.

programme.title: Changing the model
programme.desc: BMW got into the electric mobility business with their ActiveE and i3 models. We visited the company's technology office in Silicon Valley. Also: the Stuck brothers at the test track with the Mercedes C 63 AMG. And: the Audi A3 Sportback.

programme.title: BMW Motorrad Berlin
programme.desc: The first vehicle that BMW ever produced was a motorcycle, the R23. We take a look at the brand's motorcycle factory in Berlin. Also: the KTM 125 Duke, a bike that isn't just for beginners. And: the "Night of the Jumps", an exciting freestyle motocross spectacle at Munich's Olympiahalle.

programme.title: Blacktrail E-Bike
programme.desc: The Blacktrail by PG Bikes is the fastest and lightest E-bike in the world, but also the most expensive. What's behind this exciting power package from Regensburg, Germany? Also: is BMW's new flagship bike, the K 1600 GT with 6 cylinders really worth its price and is it able to stand up to the competition by Honda, Kawasaki and Benelli?

programme.title: Classic Cars with All-Wheel Drive
programme.desc: The Volkswagen Type 166 amphibious vehicle is the all-rounder amongst off-road vehicles. Also: the Peugeot 205 Turbo 16 all-wheeler turned the World Rally Championship in the 1980s on its head. And : the Willys Jeep in our drive report.

programme.title: Mobility in Eastern Europe
programme.desc: In the 1950s, companies like Tatra from Czechoslovakia introduced advanced, even pioneering automobiles. The clientele was exclusive, which is why now these streamlined cars are big rarities. We tracked down the owner of a 1937 Tatra T87.

programme.title: The big journey
programme.desc: The Mercedes-AMG E63 S is a wolf in sheep's clothing. This station wagon has more power than the Nissan GTR 'Godzilla'. Also: the Porsche Panamera GTS feels at home on the motorway and on the race track. And: Audi's powerful all-purpose executive car RS6.

programme.title: Pulse Rising Cars
programme.desc: With the Pulsar, Nissan returned to the European compact class market with a serious contender to the Volkswagen Golf. In addition: the American V8 dream sports car, the Chevrolet Corvette C7. And: Subaru's fifth-generation rally icon, the WRX STI.

programme.title: Mercedes ML 63 AMG
programme.desc: We put the Porsche Cayenne Turbo S and the Mercedes ML 63 AMG to the test. Also: the final round of the truck trial race at the Camp4fun at the Nürburgring in Germany. And: General Motors' new luxury SUV, the Cadillac SRX.

programme.title: Outback Off-Road Adventure
programme.desc: Australia's North-East is famous for its nature and wildlife. We accompanied the Germans Katrin and Uli on their 4x4 tour on the Great Tropical Drive in Queensland. Also: Clash of the Titans. We compared the Toyota Landcruiser and Mitsubishi Pajero.

programme.title: Harley Sportster 1972
programme.desc: Harley-Davidson add three additions to their model range of bikes: the motorized wheelie bike Sportster 72, the versatile Switchback Dyna, and the bad-boy ride „Softail Slim“. Also: two German bikers take a dusty adventure ride through Mexico on their BMW's. And: the Triumph Speedmaster, the British answer to Harley-Davidson's cruiser.

programme.title: Triumph Thunderbird
programme.desc: The parallel twin-cylinder Triumph Thunderbird. Is the powerful 1.6 litre bike able to gain a foothold outside of the British Isles? Also: Harley-Davidson's black chopper Sportster 883 Iron, a starter bike for purists. And: Bike & Music, a spectacle for motorbike and stunt enthusiasts at Europe's biggest motorway rest area in Geiselwind, Germany.

programme.title: Strong, Light and Fast
programme.desc: The Porsche Cayman GT4 combined the best elements that Porsche could offer. In addition: the Audi R8 V10 plus, an even stronger, lighter and faster version of the original model.

programme.title: Hypercars
programme.desc: The Mc Laren MP4 12C, the Porsche 911 Turbo S and the Mercedes SLS AMG GT are super sports cars that are second to none. We put the pedal to the metal in these exciting and powerful driving machines.

programme.title: Episode 10
programme.desc: Christian Menzel asked our presenter Miriam to participate in a driver safety training where he showed tips and tricks on what to do in emergency situations.

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Episode 12
programme.desc: Once again it was time for the VLN Endurance Racing Championship. While the drivers were doing their test laps, we had a look behind the scenes and explored what went on in the pit lanes.

programme.title: McLaren MP4 12C GT3
programme.desc: McLaren's MP4 12C GT3 is as fast as a Formula One car. We explored how this super sports car came to be. Also: the German company Mechatronik specializes in restoring rare and classic cars like the Mercedes W111.

programme.title: Supercars of the Frankfurt Motor Show
programme.desc: We took a look at the IAA Frankfurt 2011 highlights, like the new Porsche 911, Mercedes' SLS AMG Roadster, the Bentley Continental Convertible, a 1,100 hp monster from Croatia and others.

programme.title: Wildly through the desert
programme.desc: BMW and the German racing team X-Raid take part in the Dakar Rally with a transformed Mini Countryman. Also: the Mercedes G63 AMG 6x6, a 6-wheel off-road monster. And: the Kia Sportage feels both at home in the rocky terrain of Sicily and the city.

programme.title: Real Winners
programme.desc: When BMW released the X6 in 2008, many people doubted that this concept would be successful. We took a look at the second generation of this model in the M50d version. Also: test driving the best-selling Opel Mokka. And: the Mercedes GLE Coupe.

programme.title: Women and their Classic Cars
programme.desc: A small group of car enthusiastic ladies offers resistance in the otherwise man dominated classic car world. One of them is Johanna. The 24-year-old loves her 1969 Corvette more than everything.

programme.title: Scrapyard Gold
programme.desc: It is not too unusual to find hidden gems of automotive history in a perfect condition in barns or scrap yards. Also: the MGC GT Sebring, that was built for the 12 Hours of Sebring race.

programme.title: Sportscars for the Masses
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang has been an icon for decades. What makes this car so special? In addition: the Nissan 370 Z Nismo is half as expensive as a Porsche 911, but its power is on par with the German flagship. And: the 7th generation Volkswagen Golf GTI and R.

programme.title: Electrically into the Future
programme.desc: The Tesla Model S is an icon for inventiveness and boldness. In addition: the BMW i3 was the first car from Germany that completly relied on electric propulsion. And: Citroen gave their glimpse into the future with the DS 5 Hybrid.

programme.title: Ferrari FF
programme.desc: The Ferrari Four, also called Ferrari FF, is the first four-wheel family car from Maranello. Also: the BMW M5 shines both as a family and business car. And: the Mercedes-Benz SL is a roadster drivers' dream.

programme.title: When Sports Meets Indulgence
programme.desc: Luxury class grand tourers with four doors. Porsche introduced their Panamera as a Plugin Hybrid or equipped with new turbo engines. BMW responded with their M6 Gran Coupe. German engineering at its finest.

programme.title: Salto Mortale
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes face a new mission: performing a front-flip through the air with a stuntman behind the wheel of an estate wagon. Stuntmen Daniel and Lars display a brilliant fight choreography in some spectacular driving scenes.

programme.title: The Remote Control
programme.desc: Stuntman Tobi operates an Artega GT at full speed via remote control. This is just a warm-up before the big stunt, in which he drives a car up a steep ramp at 68 mph. The question is: How high can remote-controlled cars fly?

programme.title: Episode 21
programme.desc: In this episode, we focused on Phoenix Racing, the successful team from the Eifel Region that rocked the DTM.

programme.title: Episode 11
programme.desc: Spring finally melted away the snow on the track and racing life returned to the Nuerburgring. Drivers with gasoline in their veins started chasing their cars around the ring again.

programme.title: Asian Bestsellers
programme.desc: The Lexus IS-F, Nissan's GTR and Juke R and the Infiniti FX 50 are rather exotic models. Not only the futuristic design but also the performance of these Asian power packs made European car manufacturers quiver in their boots.

programme.title: Kelleners KS1 RS
programme.desc: The BMW One M Coupe from the former race-driver Ralf Kelleners: the KS1 RS is one of the highlights in 2012. Also: another big score from Porsche, the beautiful 911 cabriolet. And: the Bentley Continental GT V8 is a dream car.

programme.title: Porsche to the Max
programme.desc: The Techart Grand GT by Porsche's house tuner is a souped-up Panamera. But the off-the-shelf GTS model also has its treats. Patrick Simon took this monster to the track. In addition: Ruf's anniversary model RT 35. And: the 911 Carrera 4.

programme.title: BMW Motorrad Berlin
programme.desc: The first vehicle that BMW ever produced was a motorcycle, the R23. We take a look at the brand's motorcycle factory in Berlin. Also: the KTM 125 Duke, a bike that isn't just for beginners. And: the "Night of the Jumps", an exciting freestyle motocross spectacle at Munich's Olympiahalle.

programme.title: Blacktrail E-Bike
programme.desc: The Blacktrail by PG Bikes is the fastest and lightest E-bike in the world, but also the most expensive. What's behind this exciting power package from Regensburg, Germany? Also: is BMW's new flagship bike, the K 1600 GT with 6 cylinders really worth its price and is it able to stand up to the competition by Honda, Kawasaki and Benelli?

programme.title: Episode 22
programme.desc: At the Nuerburgring Patrick chased a 12-cylinder Aston Martin Zagato down the track. Also on the show: a Hummer, a Renault Clio and a Frenchman in a Ferrari.

programme.title: Episode 21
programme.desc: In this episode, we focused on Phoenix Racing, the successful team from the Eifel Region that rocked the DTM.

programme.title: Fiat Dino
programme.desc: The Fiat Dino Spider is one of the most beautiful cabriolets of the 1960s. Its impeccable design was created by Pininfarina, and only 525 units were built. Under its hood growls a Ferrari V6 engine.
